clinical_study.brief_title: Comparison of Tandospirone, Amlodipine and Their Combination in Adults With Hypertension and Anxiety
clinical_study.official_title: Comparison of Tandospirone, Amlodipine and Their Combination in Adults With Hypertension and Anxiety: a Multicentre, Randomized, Double-blind, Double-dummy, Placebo-controlled Trial

brief_summary.textblock: This study compares the antihypertensive effects between different treatment groups including antihypertensive drug, anxiolytic, and both, which provide a new clinical evidence for controlling blood pressure in patients with hypertension and anxiety.

detailed_description.textblock: In recent years, many studies have found that elevated blood pressure is associated with anxiety. It has been report that the incidence of hypertension with anxiety is 25%-54%. The studies have confirmed that anxiety can significantly reduce the antihypertensive effect. Therefore, anxiolytics can increase the antihypertensive effect in patients with hypertension and anxiety. However, there is currently no standard treatment for patients with hypertension and anxiety, and few clinical studies have focused on the treatment of these neglected patients. Improvement on hypertension through relieving anxiety and relief of anxiety through lowering hypertension are lack of clinical studies to prove. This study compares the antihypertensive effects between different treatment groups including antihypertensive drug, anxiolytic, and both, which provide a new clinical evidence for controlling blood pressure in patients with hypertension and anxiety.

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.measure: Office systolic blood pressure and diastolic blood pressure
primary_outcome.time_frame: Change from Baseline Office systolic blood pressure and diastolic blood pressure at 4 weeks and 8 weeks
Change from Baseline HAMA score at 4 weeks and 8 weeks
primary_outcome.description: HAMA-14 are rated on 5 grades ranging from 0(no symptom) to 4 (very severe). The total score ranges from 0 to 56. 29 or more on HAMA means severe anxiety disorders, 21 to 28 on HAMA means obvious anxiety disorders, 14 to 20 on HAMA means anxiety disorders, 8 to 13 on HAMA means suspicious anxiety disorders, 7 or less means no anxiety disorders.

secondary_outcome.measure: the proportion of patients who met blood pressure control goal( < 140/90mmHg)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Change from Baseline ABPM at 4 weeks and 8 weeks

secondary_outcome.measure: the proportion of participants with an at least 50% reduction of HAMA score from baseline
the proportion of participants showing 7 or less on HAMA

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Change from Baseline SAS score at 4 weeks and 8 weeks
secondary_outcome.description: SAS-20 are rated on 4 grades ranging from 1(a little of the time) to 4(most of the time).The standard score ranges are 25-49 (normal range), 50-59 (mild anxiety), 60-69(moderate anxiety), and 70 or more(severe anxiety).

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Change from Baseline HRV at 4 weeks and 8 weeks
Change from Baseline HAMD score at 4 weeks and 8 weeks
secondary_outcome.description: HAMD-17 are rated on 5 grades ranging from 0 (no symptom) to 4 (very severe). 7 or less on HAMD means no depression, 7 to 17 on HAMD means mild depression, 18 to 23 on HAMD means moderate depression, and 24 or more on HAMD means severe depression.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Change from Baseline CGI-I score at 4 weeks and 8 weeks

secondary_outcome.measure: Quality of Life Enjoyment and Satisfaction Questionnaire(Q-LES-Q)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Change from Baseline Q-LES-Q score at 4 weeks and 8 weeks
secondary_outcome.description: Q-LES-Q are rated on 5 grades ranging from 1 to 5 points.

intervention.description: The first group will receive a 30 mg dose of tandospirone one day( a 10 mg dose of tandospirone each time and three times a day) and a 5 mg dose of amlodipine one day(a 5 mg dose of amlodipine and one time a day).

The second group will receive a 30 mg dose of tandospirone placebo one day( a 10 mg dose of tandospirone placebo each time and three times a day) and a 5 mg dose of amlodipine one day(a 5 mg dose of amlodipine and one time a day).

The third group will receive a 30 mg dose of tandospirone one day( a 10 mg dose of tandospirone and three times a day) and a 5 mg dose of amlodipine placebo one day(a 5 mg dose of amlodipine placebo and one time a day).

The fourth group will receive a 30 mg dose of tandospirone placebo one day( a 10 mg dose of tandospirone placebo each time and three times a day) and a 5 mg dose of amlodipine placebo one day(a 5 mg dose of amlodipine placebo and one time a day).
